title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 13 ยง 201.13 - Oral argument; briefs
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 13 ยง 201.13 - Oral argument; briefs

State Regulations

Oral arguments shall be made only before the hearing officer and shall be included
in the record of the hearing. Such oral arguments may, in the discretion of the hearing officer, be curtailed, provided that a party shall be given
an opportunity to submit his argument in writing. Briefs as to facts or law shall be received and may be requested to be submitted. The hearing
officer may fix the time within which briefs shall be filed. Briefs received subsequent to such time need not be considered. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 13
ยง
201.13

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
